In my opinion it turned out to be a very bad idea. I started it feeling like the money I paid to watch "Tusk" was worth something. I ended the movie feeling horrified, nauseous and scarred for life. Most of the time horror-comedy is a good blend of genre, however the "comedic relief" they used was probably the main cause of my nausea. The main character Wallace Bryton (played by Justin Long) was in genuine danger. However it seemed as though the movie focused on his cheating girlfriend and best friend as they halfheartedly searched for him, only to lock him up like some kind of zoo animal and never look back. I was disappointed with how the film ended. Surely they could have done something, anything, in order to help Wallace reclaim what he could of his life after his traumatic ordeal. But hey, it's just a movie. However it will not be a movie I will see again any time soon.

Review title: Too annoying, Kevin Smith realley underwhelmed himself
Review_body:
This movie is just annoying. It's bad, and has zero logic at all. This should be among the worst movies of all time along with Freddy Got Fingered.The movie is complete nonsense. It says "horror-comedy", well let's take it apart:
As a comedy this is just not funny, it's boring, the jokes are just simply not good.As a horror it's... well... bad also. Not even creepy, just borderline disgusting, but not even that. That SOMETHING could be laughable, but no, not even that manages to be funny.The story is completely awful, all it does is to make the viewers hate the main character. That's all.TL;DR: not funny, not creepy, just disgusting and boring.

This is my first time entering a review. I had the chance of viewing this film yesterday and I decided to enter these lines and not to miss the opportunity of letting you readers know that I really enjoyed the film in the sense of the unexpected and surprising. I felt astonished all the way and most important: it made me think, blew out my mind. Actors very well accomplished each one his/her role. Although it seems to be a horror comedy, I would not dare to say it is one. I am at a loss to categorize this film. At the end, I made myself the question: why to keep living like this ?? This is not a question that comes up after watching a comedy....but it is always worth while. Congrats to those who made this film possible.

Would have been a 10/10 if the ending made more sense, and was more believable, in relation to the character played by the Mac Guy, should have ended at the pool scene when Depp et al comes into the pool at the end, that is where the movie should have ended up. I thought Depp played his role well, although a little annoying with the nuances of the character, and what I never clearly understood was if there was a serial killer in Canada, with the details Depp went on with, then why didn't the Manitoba Police know about these previous cases, or take the situation more seriously, with the recent coincidence of the call from Depp seriously? The script really needed more work on the ending scene. Loved the Canadian clichés.... all that maple syrup on sale in Manitoba!
One of the worst movies I've ever seen, wish I could get those two hours back.

Entering this movie with little expectation other than to see someone being forcefully turned into a walrus, I was surprised I could still be disappointed. Don't get me wrong, the movie delivered on its premise, but it also shocked me in the wrong way. I rarely get offended by a movie, but this one did manage to make me want to stop watching as soon as the character Guy Lapointe appeared at about 2/3 of the movie.Tu put it simply, this movie is simply bad. It's neither fun nor funny, scary, horrifying or sad. In fact, the only emotion one gets after watching this is the feeling of loss; time you've wasted and can never gain back.Kevin Smith takes a few jabs at Québec and Manitoba, mostly at the french-speaking province, but the Johnny Depp impersonation of a Quebecker is so far from the real thing that it's like watching a dog with a foam shark-fin attached on his back and calling it a great white shark.The scenario is bad enough, but the acting is simply horrible. Long should probably keep doing comedies or at least try. Osmont is as bad as ever since he's grown up and the main character, Howard Howe, is bland and unimaginative. This villain is nothing new in the "let's try to be weird" realm. Déjà-vu.The ending is ridiculous, the costume makes no sense and it would have been used as evidence in an investigation rather than being left for (at least) a year on Wallace after he decided (we assume) to remain a walrus. No psychiatric evaluation? I didn't give it a 1/10 simply because the credits didn't have any major spelling errors.

I will start by saying that this is not for everyone.Who would I recommend this to? If you found human centipede to be disturbing while also fascinating, and you can also see yourself laughing at a version of human centipede that takes itself a bit less seriously, then this movie is for you.There were a few moments I thought were absolutely hilarious. If you fill the above criteria, don't think about it too much and just go along for the ride. You will enjoy.

Review title: Never felt so disturb in my life!
Review_body: I gave this film a watched and after the experience I felt really disturbed and grossed out. The film itself isn't bad, it just f up anyway possible with a guy being turned into a walrus. Also loved the fact that Johnny depp was in this which was unexpected.

Review title: Loved it! Could have been better though...
Review_body: I really enjoyed this dark spin on the absolute classic tale of "man becomes a walrus". It gets really dark in places and at some points you could be forgiven for believing that it was real life. The acting was up to the standard which you expect from a film which has a budget of this size. The main criticism I would have of the film though is the mediocre sex scene and I really think they should have had real sex in order to make this seem as real as the rest of the film. If I could add anything, it would be that the walrus had crazy walrus sex and that may involve being with a human. All in all though, a real blast for the whole family.

Review title: Great horror comedy if you understand that its COMEDY
Review_body: OK so i see a lot of hate for this movie and its clear most people don't understand it. Its a comedy. Its very good at what its trying to do. My wife and i were in tears laughing at this movie, we thought it was one of the funniest we have seen in years. If you like horror comedy than this is for you. If you have a weak sense of humor or are easily grossed out don't even bother. You ll just add to the perception that its not a good movie which isn't true. Just don't take it seriously like the idiots around here and you'll love it. God i saw one review complaining about how the end could never legally happen. Duh. Its a joke. Great movie. 10/10 if your not an idiot.
Not funny, not scary. Felt like they made it up as they went along. What a waste of talent, money, and resources.

I agree with many previous reviewers' comments; the measly budget already completely wasted on this travesty of a film should have been donated to charity instead. Further, the writer-director should have allowed this utter embarrassment of a film to remain squarely at the stage of "an idea in his head" ... and promptly left to dissipate, never see the light of day. Unfortunately for the human race, oxygen and brain cells and time (that could have been better spent watching paint dry) were wasted on this ghastly, putrid endeavor.

Review title: Best horror movie ive seen in a while
Review_body: Dont mind the other reviews, i give this a 10/10. Unlike anything I've seen, and i watch lots of horror movies. The format, the way the story unravels is unexpected and refreshing. You may be very scared watching this and you might actually find it quite disturbing. Some comical points lull the viewer from what the duck did i just see, inbetween nightmares off a fever dream.

Review title: I can only sum up this movie with a song.
Review_body:
You are my walrus
My only walrus
You make me happy 
In a walrus suit 
Now don't you know dear
I love my walrus
Please don't take me out of suit.The near end of this movie had me wondering if I was high from swallowing too much cat hairs. The ending itself made no sense. I wouldn't recommend anyone waste their time unless someone wants to recommend this to the podcast "How did this get made?"

Idk what they were thinking when making this movie but boy oh boy were they mad . I just have nothing to say but i want to let people know that this is not worth your time . Go do something productive instead . Maybe it was supposed to be something like 'Human Centipede' but damn me - it turned out almost worse . Not actually scary it is just ... Traumatizing . No logic , not possible at all and just the worst thing .

Review title: Solid horror movie idea but corny dialogue
Review_body: Had some pretty morbid visuals in it but besides that the dialogue is soooo corny. It outbalanced any of the dark elements the film had. The jokes are just not funny, like something middle schoolers would laugh and joke about. Giving it 5 stars for the 2-3 scenes that were a little nasty. If you're into "bad" movies it's definitely a fun one to watch though.

Review title: Revolting, Tragic, Surreal, and Bloody Beautiful
Review_body: To be put into short words, this movie was horrific...in all the best ways.The seemingly hollowed and cheesed characters, the abrupt thematic and emotional shifts, the uncannily philosophical lashes on occasion, and the genuinely feverish antics that overcast the entirety of the film. This movie with mess with your head, yet make you to enjoy every second of it.Kevin Smith is able to drag the viewer down into the twisted, satirical ride of faux horror-comedy, and estranged occult madness. He does this while simultaneously producing a work that can snag the mind of the viewer, and shove it into a boiling pot of surreal mental disturbance, only to take it back out and sugar coat it with beautiful humor, drama, and amounts of sarcastic tone.The acting held by Justin Long was nothing short of an impressive surprise, casting forth rich humanizing emotion past his previously crude and apathetic self, as the mind of Wallace can be seen to deteriorate piece by piece through his torment. These factors are only amplified with the addition of Michael Park's outstanding performances. Himself being able to show Howard's intentions devolve, and have his dark past unfolded before the viewer in a sick concoction of memoir and nightmare.Overall, this movie is surprising, to say the least. I can guarantee you it is not perfect (and can also safely say you will not like yourself for watching it either). Yet, those flaws are highly outweighed by the obscure genius that lies in the ribald depths of this film's loudmouthed, contorted plot. From the raw characters, the tongue-in-cheek humor, the sickening effects, and almost completely convincing lore, Tusk is a revolting mind-game of b-horror that can't wait to drag you in.

First of all, so many great little nuggets for anyone with a liberal arts background. I would love to chat with Howard Howe if he weren't, ya know, a whackadoo.This movie is a disturbingly delightful blend of psychological thriller/horror/dark comedy. There were definitely moments when we had to take pause and discuss because what the actual eff.

I remember watching this movie a few years ago and it's been in my mind ever since. It's about a podcaster who lives in LA going to Canada for an interview with an internetphenomenon who went viral for accidentally cutting off his leg. When he arrives he gets the news that the boy had killed himself. Him being bummed off about not getting a story he finds a note in the toilets of a bar written by an old man saying that he's lived a long life with great adventures and offers housing in exchange for simple tasks around the house. The podcaster then goes to his place and everything takes a REALLY dark turn. He gets drugged by the old man whilst listening to his stories and wakes up with only one leg. Eventually he gets the form of a walrus after being operated on by the old man. Waking up in a cold dark cellar with a pool of water surrounding him. All this whilst his girlfriend and co-podcaster are desperately looking for him. His two "friends" eventually meet a private detective played by Johnny Depp who is looking for this old man who has apparently tried to make humans into walruses several times. Unfortunately this movie doesn't have a happy ending where he is trapped in a zoo without being able to tell anyone he's actually human.Overall i found this movie quite entertaining yet extremely disturbing with several stomach turning scenes. The disturbing scenes makes you want to cry yet makes you want to laugh since it's so surreal. (Sorry for the bad review! It's my first ever). This movie gets a 6/10.

This movie is weird. Like downright bizarre. I'm not sure why, but I was engrossed by this film. I had to keep watching even though some parts were almost unwatchable.It's funny, it's gruesome, it is the weirdest thing over ever seen. Don't go in thinking it's a normal horror comedy because it pushes both boundaries. Just be ready for a crazy ride if you decide to watch. You will both regret and not regret it.

Review title: This movie reminded me how numbing life can be
Review_body: Hello, A24 fan here! I like watching weird movies, and wow does this title deliver! Tusk was, I'm assuming, very similar in a lot of ways to being diagnosed with some fatal illness where you have months to live, and in that miserable passage, the entire time, there is a little dancing showman to constantly laugh at you. I was so high watching this movie, and by the time I finished I felt like I had been clocked in the head, but am I also going to pretend like it WASN'T justifying what happened to Justin Long? Dude kinda deserved it. :/Anyways, don't play this one at parties!

Review title: Quite possibly the worst movie of all time
Review_body: As a long time fan of Kevin Smith I have to say this movie is the most ridiculous movie I have ever seen. It's not scary, funny, entertaining, or interesting.

This movie had a good start. But half way through it got ridiculously stupid. I usually think Justin Long is such a good actor. I'm surprised he took this role after seeing the last 30-40 minutes of this movie.
Omg. I will have nightmare for a couple of weeks. This movie contained no horror. It was horrible..

Movie is very interesting because it is bissare in so many ways. I like the story, but i cant say if it is horror movie or some kind of comeddy. I just wanted to make some things clear on other person review. That person said it is unclear how is Walles still alive at the end. Well if you watch movie closely you will realise that he is in the suite that madman made from other ppl... and insade that suite is Walles without his legs and tongue.. so he is not actualy that creature we see in movie.. he is inside that "costume" traped because he cant talk or move...

Review title: What a strange movie I have seen!!
Review_body:
The best way to watch was to set it at 1.5x
It was Boring, boring, the heroes of the movie, acting was very boring
I felt if I had read the story it would have been better than I had seen it
It's like I'm watching a cheap horror movie from the '90s
I was annoyed by the movie, not because it was terrifying, but from the scenes that I don't know how to describe how annoying they were. I was laughing so weird the whole time.But I loved bringing the animal shape to reality. That was the only thing I loved.

Review title: So many mixed emotions about this film
Review_body: Tusk is one of the most memorable films I've seen, and I'll never forget the first time I saw it. I simultaneously wanted to cry, vomit, and laugh, while watching this film. I enjoy horror, but this was the first horror film that kept me awake that night. I will probably never see a walrus the same again. While there is plot holes, it is an excellent lower budget film especially considering that it took three weeks to film. I applaud Kevin Smith and I applaud the cast and all who were involved with this film.

For anyone who complained about this movie, take a second to stop and think about the premise. Kevin Smith, notorious comedian stoner type, hosts a pod-cast in which he reads an ad for somebody seeking "walrus fun". He laughs about it on his show several times, ultimately forming the plot for a silly horror movie. He draws from the Human Centipede, but decides that he wants to make it absurd. And irreverent towards Canadians. And bring in the Apple-commercial guy. And Johnny Depp. And some great actor you will long remember but had to look up his name again (Michael Parks. Michael Parks was awesome.). Then, he drew you in with a truly light hearted, endearing relationship story line. Some a**hole humor. A strange set of circumstances. Then, something truly horrible. A blend of Misery-meets-a-freak-show. But, when you put it all in the blender and add a great big dose of sketchy walrus-island crap, somehow it comes out into something so outlandish and strange, it is amazingly funny and genius. Sure, it is gross. But that is kind of the point. Personally, I think Kevin Smith has made a horror film that achieves a new standard for gore with comedy. All the better that it wanders like a stoner's mind. It makes it that much more silly and over the top. Heck, get stoned and try it. It was just fine sober. The acting was, quite honestly, top shelf for this kind of sideshow. Great stuff. Don't let the other over-analyzers with a need for "Rob Zombie or bust" horror scare you away. If this is for you, you will love it. And Michael Parks is amazing. Especially in his bit out in a cabin in the woods!

OK Jersey Girl was terrible but at least it was coherent. Tusk is just stupid, not even smart stupid.I can usually depend on Keven Smith to give us something that is at least entertaining even if it tends to the silly sometimes. But Tusk does not even reach the level silly fun.The disclaimer for the IMDb reviews requires that we give readers a spoiler alert. There is no chance of any spoiler from this reviewer. I won't even think of discussing any of the content of this film. Tusk is simple too horrible. I would never want to give any life to this abomination by talking about its content. Smith needs to consider taking it out of distribution and destroying all copies. Hopefully, his fans (and I am one) will forgive him for this gross insult.

Title says it all. It's just sympathetic and shockingly gross enough for the humor to land like a lead balloon. But it's well done storytelling and you won't be able to look away from the train wreck parts despite wanting to.

Although most people will be very quick to dismiss this movie because it came from the "Clerks Guy" Kevin Smith, I would strongly suggest you give it a shot and watch it. Yes I am a fan of all the other Kevin Smith projects but this one is completely different than all the others. It takes you through an original story like no other. The whole time you are watching you don't know whether to be freaked out or laugh. If going to see a movie different from the normal mainstream movies we are all used to isn't enough to sell you on it then the performance put together by Michael Parks will. He hasn't don much in recent years except for work with Smith on Red State and Tusk, but he is a master at his craft. I will admit that I was not sold on this movie when I first heard about it (even being a huge fan of Kevin Smith, his movies, and his podcasts) but after watching it the only thing I can say is #WalrusYes

Review title: A Real Treat If You Like Wacky Horror
Review_body: Hello. I have never posted a review before, but I thought "Tusk" was worth it because of all the reviews I've seen that I think are way too harsh and negative. I'll be fair, I don't consider Kevin Smith is a genius and I don't think this movie is even close from a masterpiece but frankly I don't understand some comments on the film that seem so full of unreasonable despise. I can understand how some people might have been disappointed when they entered the movie hoping for an actual comedy, but if you can get past the fact that this film is not really a comedy I think some will find this is a really great horror movie. Overall, the acting is not amazing (except for the creepy Michael Parks and a sometimes disturbing Justin Long)but it does the trick and it's more than enough to give you the shivers sometimes. The writing is also pretty clumsy but that's OK because it's also enough to tell you what you need to know to enjoy the ride that is a disgusting, enervating and disturbing one, but also really funny. I won't talk about the story because the less you know the better. All I can say is that I really believe that at least anyone who likes horror movies (from the classics "The Last House On The Left" and "The Hills Have Eyes", to the more contemporary "Saw" or even "A Serbian Film") will have to love this film for all it's gory moments, crazy storyline, disgusting makeups and all the things that make so many people love a cult horror movie. I'm pretty sure that in twenty years this film will be praised as a cult movie by an huge amount of fans. Watch it if you like gory, wacky horror. You'll have a great time.

Review title: Kevin Smith continues to make shitty movies!
Review_body: I've enjoyed most of his work but since Zack and Miri Make a Porno, he hasn't made a decent movie. His last 3 movies are mediocre at best and complete shite for two of them. I liked the indie geeky comedy vulgar feel of his early work, but after 2 decades, it's now safe to say, he's completely lost himself and should have stopped making movies like he said he would...I don't have a lot to say about this movie, I'm more disappointed about the evolution of his film career than anything else. The story was quite grotesque and laughable. The 3 (young) characters were uninteresting. I liked Michael Parks's performance though and Johnny Depp was quite funny. I'm not looking forward to the rest of his Canadian Trilogy...3/10 (more 2.5)

Before anyone says this film was terrible, please understand that it is purely a comedy. The horror genre is the last of the three genres on the page.THERE ARE SPOILERS IN THIS REVIEW.TUSK is essentially a satire of tragic monster stories such as David Cronenberg's The Fly or Mary Shelley's Frankenstein. Justin Long plays Wallace Bryton, a sleazy pod-cast host who benefits off of interviewing weirdos and mocking them. In retrospect, no one should ever deserve to be physically and mentally tortured into becoming a walrus, but this guy comes pretty close. He meets Howard Howe, played by Michael Parks, Howe is an interesting character who drugs him and imprisons Bryton in his home.For the first half of the film, it is almost a satire of Stephen King's Misery. Howe is very reminiscent of Annie Wilkes. He lies and lies, telling Bryton that he passed out because a brown recluse spider bit him. Occasionally, when Bryton cries out in pain or terror, Howe mocks him. He does this in the most bizarre manner that one can see his insanity but also finds humor in the situation.At no point in this film is everything taken completely seriously. There are occasional serious moments, but they deal with relationship and friendship issues. These are not the greatest issue in the whole scheme of the film. By the end, Wallace Bryton has become a human-walrus. There is a bizarre scene where Howe serenades Bryton while cuddling with him in the pool. Howe eventually dresses up in his own walrus costume, although this one is temporary. He tells Bryton that the only way he will be able to live is to defeat him in a walrus fight. Bryton's will to live is too strong and he kills Howe with his tusks. This destroys Bryton's psychosis and he becomes trapped in the state of mind that he is a walrus.Just writing this down sounds insane and there's nothing horrific about the film other than the fact that a man is being tortured by a psychopath. That entire situation of terror, however, is overshadowed by the fact that it's a WALRUS. In the end credits, the music fades out to play a portion of the pod-cast where Kevin Smith developed the idea for the film. He is laughing constantly throughout the entire thing. He knows how stupid it is and he wants to make a mockery of all the tragic monster stories.If you want to see a bizarre comedy that will make you feel as if you may have entered a new plane of existence or you have been drugged, see TUSK.

I'm a fan of most Kevin Smith movies, but this was a whole other experience. I only made it a little past the hour mark. So bad. It's so bad. I've been an IMDb member for years and I've never written a review before, but I felt like I needed to help other people avoid this movie. So bad. Omg. So bad. So bad. Huffing paint may be a better option than watching this steaming turd that Kevin Smith has crapped out. Seems promising in the beginning. After that, so bad. The worst. Holy crap. So bad.Of all the elements of the movie, Justin Long is the best. The dude is personable and funny. He is probably the only reason I watched for as long as I did. Even he can't help this movie thought. Eventually it becomes unbearable

Review title: Did I need to be high first?
Review_body: As a longtime Kevin Smith fan (movies, comics, TV, appearances and podcasts), I was expecting to really enjoy this film. Especially after seeing the fantastic trailer. It led me to believe Tusk was a psychological thriller. Which is exactly what it is for the first half of the film (once you get past the terrible "Not-See Party" puns that litter the entire film). But then Johnny Depp...uh...Guy LaPointe sidetracks the entire film with his distracting Inspector Clouseau wannabe character. I had to wonder, if this is Kevin Smith's tribute to Canada to show them how much he loves them, why did he not cast Canadian actors to play those parts? Instead I saw Americans doing Canadian accents very poorly. It was too distracting and put a slam to any horror vibe that had been built up to this point.I guess I would not have minded the horror/thriller film also being a comedy as that genre has been done well in the past (e.g., An American Werewolf in London). But I did not find any of the jokes to be funny. In fact, nobody in the theater I was in laughed even once. Does one have to be stoned to think this is funny? I suspect so. Which is too bad. I have never had this problem with a Kevin Smith film before.I really liked the premise of Tusk and wished it had stayed the psychological thriller that the trailer had promised. Like Red State, I think I could have loved Tusk if it had stayed true to the genre instead of getting sidetracked.I would like to see an alternate version when the film is released to Blu-Ray that cuts out the attempts at humor and 90% of the parts where they are looking for Wallace and instead just go directly to the final scenes at the house where the two main characters are sparring. And then I'd leave in the same ending, which was good. This version would be about 60-90 minutes long.Despite my overall disappointment in Tusk, I am happy that a strange and unique idea like this was able to be made. Especially since it got its start with a goofy advertisement. And I am still looking forward to seeing Yoga Hosers, Kevin Smith's next film, which is also set in Canada with the same actors. But I will probably wait for it to hit Netflix rather than see it in the theaters.

Review title: I fell in love with going full Walrus.
Review_body: Honestly, I went into this movie praying it wasn't going to disappoint me. I had read numerous reviews on how terrible it was and how the acting was less than appealing-but thank you Kevin Smith for not letting me down.This movie reminded me of my beloved B-Horror films, but with tremendously better acting. I cannot see how anyone can step into this film and take it one hundred percent seriously. I don't think it was ever meant to be taken seriously, which is the true beauty of this film.Michael Parks did one of the best renditions of a psychopath I have ever seen. He was creepily silly and the passion he expressed for his human-walrus was believable. That was where the true terror submerged in the film, for me at least.Johnny Depp isn't one of my all time favorite actors, but I have never seen him take an epic fail in a film. This film was no different, he nailed his part and really was almost unrecognizable due to how different his character was in previous films. I enjoyed his fun personality and need for truth.Justin Long surprised me and I cannot stress that enough. His blood, sweat, and tears shined bright in this movie.Overall, I found this movie to be quite scary- but scary in a whole new sense of the word. This is definitely what I would refer to as a dark comedy/B-horror film. If this film were to be looked at from a humorous and perspective, I think many more people would appreciate it for what it is. It's nothing short of a brilliant horror film with hidden pod cast gems.

This movie, where do I even begin. It all started with the faithful episode 259 of Kevin Smiths podcast "SMODCAST". Where they read a gumtree listing which was later found fake but contained an ad for a lodger needed who didn't need to pay rent but for 2 hours a day needed to dress up in a walrus costume and act like a walrus. Tusk was born and finally we can see this amazing movie. It is made for Kevin Smith fans and honestly I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who wasn't (although I still think I would). The whole movie keeps you entranced and wanting to know what happens next through its twisted atmosphere. You can really tell the love that smith had put into this film an it is so much fun to see the ideas himself and Scott Moiser can up with on the screen. You will be laughing the whole way through (you probably shouldn't but you will). This movie was hilarious, twisted, emotional, terrifying and shocking all in one and Justin Long and Michael Parks were terrific. This is a great movie that has been added to Kevin Smiths repertoire. #WalrusYes

The most insane film you'll ever see. Creepy funny and bizarre. You'll either love it or hate it. Just Bonkers.
I loved it!

Review title: Seriously DO NOT SEE this movie
Review_body: First off this in not a horror. It is however horrible. Sadly it is not really all that funny either. If you are expecting a brilliant comedy like most of Kevin's past work then you are in for a long sad ride. Do not spend money on this disaster. It starts out OK and then just gets really bad really quick. Then it gives a small hope in the middle but your prayers of the movie getting better fall upon deaf ears. The only thing that would make this any better is if Johnny Depp and Kevin Smith come out and say well we wanted our kids to not have an acting career...ever. So, we gave them roles in this awful movie to kill their dreams. Then and only then does it become funny again. Kevin Smith, I want my 8 bucks back!

Review title: It'll come good when you are ready.
Review_body: The movie "tusk" cost 3 million dollars, all in. Which is barely the food and per diem budget for most Hollywood movies. So nothing in the grand scheme of things. What a way to spend it though, the cast stellar, the premise questionable, Execution wonderful. It's schlocky and held together with love and great intention. So worth a watch. It will thrill, tickle and make you shiver in revulsion. And yes it is flawed. Please, Just watch it, and remember it's in the vein of those 60/70's horror movies. You know the ones I mean. Kevin may be high, (all the time these days). But, I'd spend my hard earned money to watch more of his madness.

I don't think "brown recluse, hobo spiders" are found in Manitoba. Far too cold. Unless they are carried there in luggage, etc. from the American Southwest. And not in the great numbers mention by Howe.

It's awfully lengthy before he gets to the walrus, so I read rowling's Harry Potter book, and when he gets to that walrus, it's boring like a 90-year-old grandfather telling how he got socks for Christmas, I only give 4 stars 1 for the story and the 3 for the costume otherwise it's stupid.By Kevin Smith terrible.

One of the worst things I have ever seen. Don't waste your time. You have been warned. If you like Kevin Smith don't watch this One of the worst things ever made. Poorly done. Don't do it. Don watch it. It is a waste of time. To sum it up the movie is burnt dog crap. Please save your self don't watch this. This movie is SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO bad it makes Johney Depp look bad. Justin Long is a freaking tool in this movie and a truly dumb move to make it. Kevin Smith should be ashamed to have his name attached to this. If you are going to watch it to see what the failed walrus looks like just Google what it looks like. Please don't watch this.

I find this movie full of drama and the acting is very good. it is an-unusual movie maybe a little strange bud not for long so bad as all you Americans find the film. i had some moments of intense horror and i Don't have that often. I like Justin Long in this role, i don't think its ease to play . And i loved the black comedy in it. Am i really the only one who likes this movie??.

I really enjoyed the movie. Crazy original, funny and gross! But Johnny Depp performance was meh. And as a French Canadian, am so irritated to see french canadian characters played as French people living in Canada. Cut it with the accordion music and the beret that doesn't represent us at all.

Review title: If you love effed up things, you will love this movie!
Review_body: This film will only be appreciated by those with a certain type of morbid, twisted, absurd sense of humor. If that's not you, sure, you'll probably hate it. But this was one of the best and most memorable times I've ever had in a theater. Will it make you cringe? Yes. Will it make you question what is wrong with you as you laugh  off? Of course! Which is what makes it so great! Enjoy!

As someone who liked Red State, I was still expecting something good to come from Kevin Smith. It is appalling how terrible this piece of c**p movie is. I could not even get halfway through because it made me so angry that someone could trick me into watching this piece of s**t. The one good thing about this movie is that it makes people realize the human- centipede had some good qualities. I am embarrassed for Kevin Smith for he will be forever connected to this abomination of a movie. I will never be able to erase from my mind the terrible acting, ridiculous script, and the harsh reminder of how ridiculous the kid from the 6th sense looks. Spoiler alert - I fast forwarded and the entire movie is terrible.

This was not as bad as people have said it was. It's an odd kind of movie and may not be everyone's cup of tea. From the trailer, you can pretty much guess what's going to happen. Wallace (Justin Long) character is a jerk. For a pod-cast, he and Haley Joel Osmond delight in humiliating others (in this case, one man in Canada). He goes to Canada to interview this man when it "falls through". After reading an interesting tale on the wall of a bathroom, he finds Mr. Howard Howe and things pretty much go south from there. To Mr. Howe's credit, he has had an incredible life with even more incredible stories.Truthfully, Wallace (Justin Long 's character) gets what he deserves. He's just a horrible person who takes delight in berating and embarrassing others. No human being should take delight in intentionally hurting others. The crux of this movie,, in my opinion, looks at the difference between humans and animals and the will to survive. Mr. Howe (Michael Parks) is an interesting character, having been brutalized in an orphanage between the ages of 10-15 and then the boating accident. It's possible he did not want another Mr. Tusk, but to make someone feel as bad as he does or share in his pain. However, Mr. Howe is inhuman and has completely lost touch with reality. Mr.Howe is no animal, but something far worse, as animals kill to protect themselves, there young, or to eat. Is it possible that Wallace needed to find his humanity this way (the last 5 minutes of the movie shows this) and did Mr. Howe, in sadistic way, need someone to shift his pain onto all the while losing his own humanity??? I know...kinda deep!!!The movie has its quirky parts (the walrus fight) and Johnny Depp is fabulous. Again, this movie is not for everyone. The last 5 minutes of the movie was deeper than I thought Kevin Smith could go...at least I took the meaning deeper. It's not a horrible film. It's odd and creepy, but it wasn't bad.

Semi-Spoiler (But not really) Horrible movie, My wife and I walked out before the end. First it was boring with predictable jokes and plots. Then after a half hour you just get to listen to Justin Log scream for the rest of the movie.... That I saw anyway!! Do not waste your time!!, wait till it's free somewhere. Truly sad, I am a fan of Kevin Smith's work but this was off the mark!I hope the next horror movie that Kevin Creates is worth the time to see it!!If you truly have nothing else to do and no where else to go and looking to waste money..... just burn the cash!
Has got to be the worst movie ever created and I have seen a lot of bad movies.

I wanted to love this movie. I thought the concept was hilarious, scary, and just nuts enough to work. But I have to admit, I was disappointed - it wasn't anywhere near as good as I'd hoped it would be.While the horror element was definitely there, I felt the humour didn't quite match up. Yes it was funny, but it could have been a lot funnier (though I might have felt this way because I was more annoyed than amused by a certain cop character...).It was also a little too long. There were some scenes that could have been trimmed down or cut altogether, and that lost it a star for me.I know a lot of people have said you either love or hate this film, but I'm sitting in the middle of the road, leaning towards "love" because there was so much of this that worked -- the acting, the script, the cinematography, the subtlety of some of the jokes. But for me it just wasn't enough to scrape a higher rating.If you want to see something truly wacky and disturbing, with just enough "wtf" moments to make it funny, then go and see this film. Whether or not you liked it, you'll still walk out of the theatre going, "The hell did I just watch?"

Review title: Horror meets Comedy in an amazing way
Review_body: Wallace Brighton (Justin Long) is a character you love to hate and Howard Howe (Michael Parks) is fantastically terrifying and hilarious at the same time. This movie is full of horrifying and cringe-inducing visuals that will also leave you laughing. The film is a brilliant mash-up of horror and comedy that will only leave you wanting more (which is good, as Kevin Smith's "Canada Trilogy" is just getting started). All of the clever, subtle jokes and touches juxtaposed with the humor of the characters become exceptionally funny. Michael Parks gives a performance that is both hilarious and incredibly creepy and unsettling. Even though Justin Long's character deserves what's coming to him, you can't help but feel bad (and laugh) as he screams and cries like a walrus or is forced to eat a raw fish. This movie is a better horror film than most that have already or will be coming out during this years Halloween line up, and it was a lot funnier than most of this year comedies. All together, it was definitely one of the most fun movies I have seen this year.If you like horror, comedy, drama, weird and creepy imagery, and weird movies that leave you feeling odd, but satisfied, I highly recommend this movie.

Often times horror lends itself to be overly absurd and self aware but with Tusk you kinda just get the impression that the film makers couldn't master horror or comedy so they blended them together for this film that is goofball human-centipede knockoff.

Walking into the theater with my friends, I did not know what to await of this movie as I hadn't heard anything about it, however, one of my friends said that trailer looked pretty interesting so the movie should be okay (I have to say that trailer does not represent the actual atmosphere in the movie). I trusted him but, boy, was I wrong to trust my friend on this one.While watching the movie I couldn't bare the lame jokes and the mix of horror and comedy which made movie awfully grotesque and disturbing to watch. This movie wasn't funny or scary it was plainly disgusting and sickening. Although, I feel that some people enjoyed this movie much more than I did, (from the observation of couple of laughs here and there) all of my friends were upset that we wasted our time watching this dreadful movie. Overall, I feel bad for even contributing to this movie the money I paid for the ticket. Worst movie I have seen in a long time.

Review title: 7 for the first half, 3 for the second half
Review_body: First half is good and funny. Great setup for the characters and the conversation between the two main characters is fascinating. Second half is way too silly and cringy. They started too soon with the transformation.

i went into this curious about what i might find & i have to say i was not impressed. the whole film is is just truly bad, the acting, the story, everything. i have no opinion of Kevin Smith as a writer/director so i'm not in the Kevin Smith bashing brigade. the so called comedy was non-existent unless you call Johnny Depp hamming it up as usual comedy. Kevin smith should be ashamed of himself if he thinks this is entertainment & so should everyone else involved. if this the start of a so called trilogy then i will not be going out of my way to watch the other two. this film truly sucks & unless you are a Kevin Smith fan then avoid this film

Review title: Depp? Really! Human Centipede dark comedy on steroids!
Review_body: I have no idea what genre this movie would ACTUALLY fall under, maybe a new one "comedic horror bromance with a touch of Depp". Honestly Johnny Depp was superb. Michael Parks was also excellent. I went into this movie thinking it was going to be terrible and I would turn it off 1/3 of the way through. NO. That didn't happen. If you like horror (house of a 1000 corpses, human centipede) & weird dark comedies.. well this film is for you. I mean the acting wasn't breathtaking, and the plot was ridiculous, but it came together magically. Great job. By the way I know this is Kevin Smith movie, and really I don't care for Kevin Smith too much (sorry just being honest), but he really outdid himself this time. I don't listen to his pod casts and have no idea how this plot actually came to fruition, but whatever way he did he should do it more often. I will definitely watch you're movies if you do.

Review title: Not the best but not the worst
Review_body: I can't say I'm surprised at how many terrible reviews there are of this movie, but honestly it's just not the worst. Not in my opinion anyway, and I know everyone is entitled to their own. Yes, there were several points in the movie that were quite disappointing (the end, for example), but also some that were incredibly interesting. Especially the scenes between Justin Long and Michael Parks. There were a few times when the tension was so thick I thought I was suffocating a little. In all honesty, I'm very intrigued (and terrified) by the whole plot of this movie. Serial killer? Awesome. Survival of the fittest? Why not. Cool, although slightly lacking, back story? Can't hurt.The whole premise of this film is very interesting and probably could have done better if it were in someone else's hands, but alas, that was not the case. I'm just glad a movie was made that wasn't your typical serial killer/kidnapped drama like I see in most movies and TV shows now a days. If you think you'd be interested in this, I recommend watching it. If you end up not liking it you could at least say you watched one of the weirdest and most terrifying moves ever made.
Possibly one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my lifetime!!!

Review title: Kevin Smith makes a thoroughly Kevin Smith Movie
Review_body: To be quite honest, I went into Kevin Smiths world premiere of Tusk not knowing what to think; should I take this movie as comedy or a thorough horror? The truth is the flick is both and Kevin Smith has done something I have never seen before.When quirky mean-spirited pod caster Wallace Brighton (Justin Long) journeys to Canada to interview weird and wacky people not all is as he expects as this movie proves that not all Canadians are nice.Howard Howe is hands down the best character I have watched in a while and its not surprising when he is played by Michael Parks. Howe is in love with his stories but after a while you begin to wonder if they are even real.Parks shifts from funny to terrifying to just plain weird will stay with you long after the film ends. He also happens to be immensely quotable in this flick "are you really mourning your humanity,I don't understand! Who in the hell would want to be human" or "We must discover if man is truly a walrus at heart" stayed with me long after the credits rolled.Look I can't really review this movie without giving to much away, its a flick about a guy who turns the apple guy into a walrus. But that is why you have to see it. I too thought the concept was bizarre but the movie works and hats off to Kevin Smith for making one of my favorites of the year.

Being in Australia, I have had to wait a little longer to get my eyes on this beauty, but boy was it worth it!I was disappointed to see that the film was showing on one screen in SA, and had no advertising here whatsoever. The film may have done poorly in the states, but I think it would have thrived here. Onto the point. This film is what it promises to be. One of the best produced B-grade horror movies I have ever seen. Although it doesn't ever really scare, it does get quite creepy, and on occasion it is pretty damn funny too. I don't know how you can give a bad review to this film. If you walk into the cinema understanding that the central premise of this film is about a man being hacked into a Walrus, you are either going to love it, or you were secretly hoping that it wasn't a film about a guy getting hacked into a Walrus.While this film may not have made its money in cinemas, it is going to be regarded as a cult classic if ever there was one. I mean, the climactic scene (the one in which the Fleetwood Mac song 'Tusk' plays) is nothing short of hilariously disturbing, over-the-top chaotic brilliance. I could watch it over and over.

The beginning of the movie started out great and definitely had potential to be one of Kevin Smith's greater movies, and a movie that could be watched by anyone who was generally into horrors. However, after a certain point very early on, the movie stops being scary, and becomes extremely difficult to take seriously. It wasn't even so bad that it was funny, it was just absolutely terrible. This is the worst movie I have ever seen in my life, which is a hard thing for me to say, since I'm a fan of many of Kevin Smith's movies. Save yourself the trouble and watch a different movie. You will be better off not seeing it.

Review title: Not just another Kevin Smith Movie
Review_body: After reading other peoples reviews I am shocked that these people call themselves "Kevin Smith" fans. Not saying everything Kevin Smith has done has been a gem, but this movie Tusk is way different.While it was derived from a Pot induced Smodcast, Kevin Smith took seriously the idea of making a real movie not his usual dick and fart type. Characters had depth, characters had emotions.Tusk didn't let us down with a few nutty characters but the premise was to stay focused on the plot and that he did.Tusk is different and its a great film, if you go into it hoping for another Clerks, you are going to be extremely disappointed. Go in with an open mind and you will find yourself enthralled.

Review title: More "Sssssss"(1973) than "Boxing Helena"(1993) but you decide for yourself.
Review_body: I was not expecting the level of comedy in this film. That said, it was the best part about Mike Smith's attempt at horror. The laughs are non-existent until the mid-way point. Up until then, we have a none too vague attempt at "Boxing Helena" style catch and control. Michael Parks' turn as the quack with adolescent trauma issues manifesting in serial killer play maker is arguably the best performance in the picture. I found Guy LaPoint's turn as the reincarnation of Peter Falk circa Columbo to be too ham-fisted in attempting comedy. The problem I have, and maybe others will have with this film is this: If you want to be a horror movie then bring the originality of ideas with ingenious builds of suspense, or, If you want to be a comedy, then make the comedy clever and relative. This film was trying to be both (or maybe neither) which leaves it in a world equally as interesting. Next!

I am numb. I can only imagine that this feeling I have is akin to what someone who just found out they have cancer and they are going to die feels like for the first 30 seconds after hearing the news. I didn't laugh at this movie, I didn't cringe from being grossed out, I didn't shrink in fear. All I can say is that I watched it. It's almost as though I just had a great practical joke played on me, only I didn't get the punch line. It's like this was made because it could be made. That being said, it is more than I could do, but it saddens me to see any currency that Kevin Smith had was spent on this. It truly feels like it was made for Kevin Smith, his friends, and his die hard fans, which is great if you are in one of those categories. I thought I was indeed one of those fans, but I might have to rethink that. It's not that I hated it, or it was the worst thing I have ever seen. (Anyone who grew up on 80's TV has seen so much worse) I am not knocking you Kevin, I love ya. I saw all the other movies, DVDs, read your book Tough SH&T (which was very moving BTW) but I honestly feel like I missed something here. I was hoping for more of what you have put into those other ventures put into this one. You are truly an inspiration to many of us out here, and there are times you have told stories that have moved me very much. If you are a die hard fan, by all means watch this movie. If you are looking for something that will keep you interested, laughing, or even hiding behind your hands, this is not for most. I truly believe that Kevin Smith can make great movies, and write fantastic things. For me at least, this is not one of them.

This is a horrible film. I hated every second. If you have any morals at all - religious or otherwise - you must not watch this movie. It will turn your stomach. I really wish Smith and his cohorts would just disappear into the ether. Why do people still allow him to make pictures? The very start of this film was, I thought, a gag but turns out to be real. Horrible special effects right off the bat. There are supposed to be subtle jokes about Canadians but I experienced none. The writing is awful and the directing goes far beyond even being called sub-par. What has happened to Kevin Smith? From a Jersey boy to this. It is sad, to say the very least. There seems to be no good ideas left in him and it angers me that he continues to push his career along, like a dying cow giving birth to an obviously stillborn calf. How humiliating it must be.

Review title: Pod caster goes on a trip up north for a big interview, plans change and he makes the most of his time by getting a chance to hear the storied life of an eccentric stranger..
Review_body: This movie has almost everything a true horror fan could ask for.. Scary, sick, disturbing , funny, twists, and get this, actors that actually did there jobs! Justin Long shows fear, TRUE fear better than most A list actors are capable of. Not to mention the writing, the goal of a good horror is to transport the viewer into the movie and make them live what's happening knowing the decisions of the characters are the same ones we would make if we were in the same situations. And no cheats like most horror movies fall back on (eg every one that the character is running full tilt and must be in the clear only to run straight into the killer) This truly is a feast for the senses and long after it's over you'll be dwelling on what you just witnessed... I'm still hearing that ring tone in my head..

Review title: Really bad DO NOT WASTE MONEY!!!
Review_body: This is one of the worst movies i've ever seen. Very unrealistic, and just really unusual. The walrus the serial killer creates towards the end looks very unrealistic and also some of the situations in the movie are very unrealistic such as when Wallace is calling his girlfriend saying that he needs help. Wouldn't you think he would be calling 911 before anyone else? Also at the end of the movie Wallace is put into a zoo.. I don't think that he would live through any of that and even if he did, why would they put a human being who was turned into a walrus into a zoo? I don't know how this was ever put into theaters. I'm warning you, do not waste your money or time on this.

The ending was an absolute disgrace !! Like they would leave him too live as a mangled body of decaying flesh with a nice little dog house and pool .Really disappointed in this movie started off looking good , but I can't help thinking maybe the movie would of been better if the old man have just told him the story and whoever the main character was just spend 60 minutes in a back and forth in the pod-cast show . After Red State was expecting a bit more , now I think Kevin Smith is just messing with us .I have seen Rick and Morty episodes that were more realistic than this .

I don't give a sh!t what anyone says, this movie owns. First of all, he's not trying to make the fvcking godfather, and you wish you could turn an idea you had while stoned into a movie, yeah you wish could, but you can't cause your not Kevin Smith, dumb ass.This movie is about a man becoming a walrus against his will. This is some real walrus sh!t. Think about it dude, a regular guy, plucked out of his boring stupid life, and guess what motherfvcker? Your a walrus now. Deal with that sh!t. Are you gonna fight being a walrus? Huh? GL with that. Or are you just gonna give in and go full walrus. Yeah, give in, go full walrus, and watch Tusk now.

Kevin Smith is a strange guy but why the hell would he create this? I mean come on.... You could've done better than this. As disturbing as it may be and as darkly humorous as it is, it lacks substance. It's like a pile of crap that was called a film. The rating is at a 6???? It should be at most a 2. I give this movie two big thumbs down in a pile of crap!!! Kevin Smith please for the sake of the film community release something with substance. Bring Jason Lee back in on a project and use him well. Jason Lee I know him from Silverdale and he has far more talent than what he has been used for. Please do another cynical dark comedy but not one like this. Make Lee the main character for once. He deserves it not this stupid Mac Computer guy who plays the same role in every movie...Sincerely, A Guy losing respect for your film making abilities BTW New Jersey sucks ;)

If you're going to watch this movie do it online and don't give that fat bastard your money. I saw this at the movies because I wanted to see what the walrus looked like. I was disappointed. The movie starts off awfully with Justin long and some other guy watch a really fake, unfunny video clip of some guy cutting his leg off. The effect is so bad it looked like a cartoon. Every special effect in this movie is awful(especially the dead walrus). The dead walrus was literally like a brown sleeping bag full of pillows. The acting in this movie is god awful everyone does a bad job here, especially Johnny Depp(and I like him).The walrus/human looked too rubbery and we're supposed to believe its skin. The movie isn't even so bad its good it's just really bad.I hope no one else watches this, not even smith fans can defend this.

Review title: I made an account for IMDb especially to down-rate this abomination
Review_body: This movie was the worst thing I've ever seen in my life. What a goddamn waste of time. It was good at the start, guy gets captured and all that. Then it started to go downhill. It was even OK when the crazy man was turning him into a walrus, whatever, go for it you crazy ass man. It was when he was found that ruined the whole thing for me. The friends find him, and somehow by then (the short short space he had been captured for) he had completely turned into a walrus. Somehow. The mind of a walrus. Then his friends.. instead of helping him, getting him plastic surgery to remove this walrus suit, they just put him in a goddamn walrus house, with a little pool and ball, and feed him goddamn raw fish like fudging idiots. Like seriously. It made me so mad. SO SO MAD. Im mad even typing this. I get mad when i hear the word tusk or see this actor anywhere. This movie is the worst thing ever. F U Tusk.

this is the single most profoundly distasteful product of man animal nature and trans-planetary chemical matter in the history of everything, it is worse than bubonic plague bad... the acting was an appalling take on bitterly undeveloped characters and its shock value is all shock and no value. any attempt to draw conclusions based on plot is futile and the critic who dares draw social metaphors from this should be fired, shot and fired again and then shot again. in my 30 years this was the most painful visual experience i ever had to endure.please save yourself from contact of any sort with this atrocity or buy it for someone you deeply hate at your own legal risk

Review title: I want the 2 hours of my life back.
Review_body: I do not usually write reviews but after seeing this I thought I needed to let the people know to stay away. I think I laughed at one part the rest was like having a person vomiting in your ear for almost two hours. The acting was not bad but it was a horrible idea for a movie. Do not make the same mistake I did. Go watch something else. Anything. Here is a run down of the movie. Protagonist Wallace Bryton (Justin Long) is a pod-caster who makes it his job to harass people who do stupid things on the internet (I think there is a show like this without the walrus part). Antagonist Howard Howe (Michael Parks) is obsessed with walruses. The girlfriend, Ally Leon (Genesis Rodriguez), started out seeming like a nice person but just as sleazy as her boyfriend. The Best Friend, Teddy Craft (Haley Joel Osment), is just a jerk that betrays his jerk of a friend. If you do decide to watch it just remember I did try and warn you.

Review title: what the F did I just watch
Review_body: If I could have given this movie negative stars, I would have. This was accidentally rented after my Mother tried to rent Horns, and mixed her words, and came out with Tusk. We did not catch this until about an hour into the movie, in which the man was mutilated and turned in to nothing but an innocent walrus. Then, the movie had the audacity to end as the man being left in a walrus cage, at a wildlife conservatory, being fed a raw fish, by his love. Not only do the sounds of the human thing still ring in my ears, but I am having a hard time looking at a picture of any walrus, and I fear that I will never be able to look at one again. I am truly mortified that I watched this film and I do not understand how it was made. On the same note, it's going to be fantastic recommending this total psychopathic movie to all of my friends, and waiting to see their reactions. Thank you Kevin Smith for ruining walruses. And any future zoo trips. I'm going to ask you kindly to never create another animal movie while on drugs, especially about giraffes.

Review title: Best movie ever.worth every penny and even more pennies
Review_body: I seriously love this movie. Acting and directing is perfect. Never have I ever seen better screen writing in my entire existence. this movie has inspired me to take up surgery as a hobby as well as learning the walruses anatomy. I am even contemplating abducting people and turning them into walruses just as beautful. It's very interesting to see that people give this movie such bad reviews it's even appalling. Tthis movie really gets into how important the walrus actually is to this beautiful world that this world needs more people walruses on every corner. I will watch and conceive my children to this movie on my honeymoon when I eventually find someone who loves this movie as much as I do. I will name my first born walrus as to show tribute to this beautiful art work of a movie. This movie convinced me Single handily to seriously contemplate having reconstructive walrus surgery in Beverly hills.

Review title: First ever review: "Artists" trying to out "artist" each other
Review_body: By the time I reached the end I felt like I was a third person in a room with some actors and Hollywood people trying to impress each other with how artistic they could be. Johnny Depp makes sure to remind the viewers that he likes to be strange, the conversation between Depp's character and Parks seems like they are ad libbing and trying to one up each other with each line to see who could say the strangest thing.The movie is basically a joke on the viewer. One of those, you had to be there, types of things that was probably funny for a few minutes. I see that the whole movie took only 15 days. I am not surprised because I think if they had taken any longer they would have realized that maybe it wasn't such a good idea.I'm sure people who like the movie probably like it more because of reviews like this and how I just don't "get it". I get it, you took a funny ad, made fun of it, had some viewers say that it would be funny if it was a movie, then had fun making a horrible movie. Doesn't make it any more entertaining for someone watching.Usually I can tell when a movie is about artists trying to prove how artistic they can be when the main character is a writer. The main character as a DJ threw me off.

Review title: Great acting, but a lot missing
Review_body: I was initially intrigued by the concept & trailer when this movie first came out. Knowing not many other people I know would be willing to see this movie I took it upon myself to go watch it alone and I was disappointed. The acting in the movie was very good and for the most part every cast member put on great performances.The beginning of the movie seem to be okay, but once it moves to Canada that is where it seems to go downhill (not immediately, but slowly). The back and forth of Wallace & Ally just didn't feel well written and The mixture of horror & comedy just seemed like it missed, with jokes coming at the wrong times and not hitting their marks. The scene with Ally talking to the camera was just way too predictable, but yet felt rushed filler. It didn't show much and didn't really go anywhere after that. If they didn't have the scene that explained them being together, it wouldn't have changed anything in the movie. Teddy is still Wallace's friend & partner, Ally is still his girlfriend so, they still probably went together to go find him. After they decided to go find Wallace, that is where it starts feeling very rushed, like they weren't really too sure where they could go with it and just needed the ending from their smodcast. I normally like Kevin Smith movies and always go into them with an open mind, but this one just felt like they had trouble stretching the concept into a full length feature movie without knowing which direction they wanted to go, while changing their minds halfway through filming. I will give this a 3 star rating though, because there are a few saving points, but not enough to keep the movie afloat. Once again the acting is pretty much great across the board, the soundtrack is decent, the angles of the film are nice, but sometimes predictable. The effects are a little cheesy, but work for the most part.

Review title: Good entertaining film deserves better rating
Review_body: Watching the film I like many was skeptic all. I'm a Kevin Smith fan and love his earlier work but the first film that stood out for me by him was absolutely Red State. I found it to be a modern horror revaluation, and honestly I think people don't like it because it's new and different. To compare this movie to Human Centipede is ridiculous. It's not torture porn more is overly graphic but rather I found it to be a piece filled with irony and allegorical humor aimed at the overly egotistical audience that makes up America. If you can't see the genius in the irony in this film you need to watch it again and give Smith a break. It was a good movie, not a classic but I gave it an 8 to help balance out the IMDb score because it seems there's just a lot of crap talking haters on here. But really it was a solid 7.7. Entertaining, don't watch with the kids and take it for what it is. A good new age horror with a good production value, good acting and a great writer/director that is Kevin Smith.

I was intrigued and excited to watch Tusk being a fan of Kevin Smith, the actors, and the odd story line. After watching it, I walk away with the sure knowledge that I wasted almost two hours of my life.This is by far the worst movie I have ever seen, and I am a fan of low-budget horror of all times; that shows how bad some of the movies I've watch can be. That being said, there was nothing in this film that made it even remotely worth watching. The actors were good, but even they weren't even good enough to breath life into this movie and make it worth watching. All the positive reviews here seem to be biased on the sole basis of this being a Kevin Smith project. Seriously folks (who enjoyed this dribble) think about it- would you have enjoyed this movie at all if it had been a no-name up and coming writer/producer?Kevin Smith fan or not, save yourself the lost effort and don't bother with this dud.

Review title: A message to kevin smith from a die hard fan
Review_body: Dude. Seriously? Wtf? I want to start by saying that everything from clerks to zack and miri make a porno were brilliantly written. I have watched them all handfulls of times. And I get it that you are trying to not do jay and silent bob movies any more. But this is just crap. Jersey girl was great. Zack and miri make a porno was excellent. Comedy is your forte. So wtf man? If the goal is to make a movie that no one cares to see twice, then you have succeeded on your last two outings. I wont even recommend this to other ks fans. And im not trying to be a dick but I feel like you were when you made this. Like your saying "f u im kevin smith and can do whatever I want." I gave it 2 stars because of the acting. It was top notch for what garbage they had to work with. I was looking forward to seeing justin long in another smith movie(his character in z and m was one the funniest characters ever). The whole cast is actually a great ensemble(where has hjo been all this time). Michael parks is an amazing actor and you have just ruined him for people in your last 2 movies. At least for me(I now feel like he makes poor script choices and don't care to see his next movie).If this is your new direction then im done giving a s$#t. I can come up with ridiculous ideas off the top off my head to but it doesn't mean they should be movies. You're insulting everyone with this and not in an ironic or funny way. Its just crap.

Review title: I joined IMDb to unleash hate on this
Review_body: God where do I start on this.I went into this with fairly low expectations and can report that my initial assumptions were on the money. This movie is obviously a pretty vane attempt on behalf of Kevin Smith to take the p*ss out of the movie going public. Storyline is lame at best, either trying hard to be like Human Centipede or making parody of it, i can't work out which.Of course with films by Smith you would expect a lot of witty banter amongst the characters and this has it in spades, that is if you like the low brow dick joke type humor. The bad Canadian jokes just made things worse, i should have known to turn it off at this point, but no i persevered. Justin Long is as you would expect, but only worse, its as if he turned the douche dial up to 500. The best thing about this steaming pile of turd is the character of Howard Howe. This actor performed admirably however probably shouldn't have signed up for this cr*p.So by now you probably already now that Long gets turned into a walrus. I knew that before i watched it and must have had a brain fart because i went ahead with it anyway. I regret it know but the only saving grace is that I turned it off as soon as Johnny Depp made an appearance, not because of him but because i couldn't take it anymore. I'm guessing that the last 40 minutes or so wasn't an improvement on what I have already seen. I don't know if this is supposed to have some kind of deep arty metaphorical undertone, maybe I'm missing something? But judging by the number of bad reviews on here by other probably fairly normal people I'd say i'm not too far wrong. Do yourself a favor and watch something else. I'm glad i didn't pay any money to see this.

Review title: I Wish I Could Unsee This Film...
Review_body: There are few films that I dislike to such an extent where I would actually pay a considerable price for a crazy scientist to lobotomise the part of my brain which remembers it. Tusk is one.But in the interest of being 'fair' I'll begin with the positives. Sorry, positive. The acting, in majority, is OK. (Johnny Depp, I presume, can only have agreed to partake as a joke or because he actually doesn't care about his reputation anymore).Right, now the pleasantries are to one side I can continue. So think of Human Centipede. Gross right? Crass? Tusk is a whole new level of vile. Don't believe the tempting notion that this is based on a true story, supposedly Kevin Smith and his mate where discussing a Gumtree add which advertised free living if the lodger agreed to dress as a walrus...The thing that irritated me the most about this film, aside from the insanely non-funny comedic elements and special effects that look as though the production company allowed the intern free-rein of the art room, is the ending. I won't ruin it, anyone who sits through the entirety of the film without throwing up or crying or trying to scratch their eyes out will need to see it in order to confirm how ridiculous and awful it really is (honestly).All in all I'm not sure whether I really 'get' what this film is meant to represent. And by this I simply mean that maybe I'm not weird enough to appreciate it.

Good god. Save me from the awful picture I see before me now. I'm surprised by how little I really watched of this movie, yet still was able to fully understand what was going on just by glancing at the screen every once and a while. I regretfully have said I've seen this film and I leave this with readers:Only one thing worth seeing this movie for: -the wonderful Johnny Depp--however, he was only in 1/24th of the movie. Which is the fraction I was able to figure out while watching this god forsaken movie. As well as register for IMDb and write this review.

Review title: Best movie I've seen in a while
Review_body: I won't lie, a large portion of people won't like this movie. It has a slow pace, weird dialogue and an unconventional plot. Aside from this, however, the humour is wicked and dark, for those who get it it will soon be one of your favourite movies. If you're the kind of person who loved the comedy/horror style of House of 1000 Corpses you could find yourself laughing out loud at the characters and situations in this film.I would recommend seeing it, but don't go in with expectations of classic horror plots or slapstick humour. The cast are excellent, the production value is top notch and the easter eggs in this movie are really great if you've been a tusk fan before production even started.

I love horror films. I even love bad horror films. This is so bad that I wish I had never seen it. Not only is the premise so terrible that I don't know how it ever got turned into a film, but the over the top, don't understand Canada because I didn't bother to look anything up, so I'll just make sh*t up stereotypes are so bad that the suspension of disbelief gets thrown out the window.I have been a fan of Kevin Smith's movies until this point, even though I think he's been going downhill since Clerks (which was awesome), but even his name/vision/idea can't save this piece of dung.It truly is just bad. Without wanting to post spoilers, I can't say much more, but just avoid this piece of crap at all costs. If you truly want to waste your time on a terrible movie, there are many better choices. Highlander 2 comes to mind. (That's right. I think this is worse than Highlander 2. Well, not really, but at least Highlander 2 is something you can scream at for being bad instead of this insipid, badly done, not-even-trying, put-something-out-because-I'm-Kevin-Smith, bullsh*t.)

I decided to watch this movie on a Monday night after watching well known reviewers review this film. They went on to say that this film was one of their all time favorites. Frankly i was disappointed in the horror aspect. It was disturbing at some points but after awhile the story line dragged on and the ending just didn't do it for me. The "creature" in this film was to quickly turned and i don't think there was enough suspense there. I do not recommend this for people who are looking for a scare but rather for people who find entertainment in the lack of a storyline and plot.

If you haven't seen Kevin Smith's Tusk yet, let me spare you two hours: don't. Although there is some good horror in here--the villain is one of the most demented ever. Although there's some good comedy in there--and it won't be unfamiliar to fans of Clerks and Smith's other work. It just never feels like a cohesive film. I'd go as far to say that Kevin Smith knows little about horror. A scary, horrifying film can be funny--but it ought to be funny in the right place at the right time. Why did no one look at this film and tell Kevin Smith, "Look, pal, you've got some work to do"? Although some elements work well independently, there's disharmony when they're combined. It's as though Tusk was directed by two directors with clashing styles. Extreme horror is and Kevin Smith self-aware comedy undermine each other, which left me with the feeling that I was a victim of the world's most malicious practical joke.And that's not even the worst part of Tusk.There's a cameo from a well-known Hollywood start in the last quarter of the film, and I won't name him just in case you want to waste two hours of your life watching Tusk. Well, this well-known star contributes to completely ruining this film. The acting is so campy, so bad that I think Tor Johnson spun in his grave. But one has to put that on Kevin Smith as well. After all, a director's job is to DIRECT the actors, and I don't give care about the size of this particular actor's ego. Judging by this performance and his recent roles, he shouldn't have much of an ego left.Save your time. There's better stuff to watch.

I did not know exactly what to expect going into this movie. It starts of very "normal", but then it quickly takes a turn and becomes this awesome twisted movie that you wont soon forget. I have to say that this movie is not for everyone, but give it a chance if you like Saw or the Human centipede. The movie actually left such a big impression on me after watching it as a good night movie(which I don't recommend doing), that I could not fall a sleep right away and had to sign up an account here on IMDb just to give this review. Its a shame that so many people gave it a bad review in here, but don't let that scare you away, you might just be a freak like the rest of us weirdos who loves movies like this, and remember to come in here and leave another positive review if you like it.

Kevin Smith has done it again. This time he's smack dab made me sick to my stomach. My daughters stopped the movie because of the disturbing and grotesque image that has since still remained in my minds eye. At the beginning, I felt slapping the character portrayed by Justin Long (Wallace) because of his obnoxious and crude behavior. As the movie went on, my view of him changed from angst, to pity and I ultimately found myself tearing up in the last segment. I won't give details, but let me say this, I will never satisfy my curiosity about a Kevin Smith movie again. And Kevin, if you have a point to make about society and all the chaos it represents, then go to politics. In this movie, I can tell you had the "I don't give a f**k" attitude. This movie is not for the faint of heart. It wasn't even funny. It is supposed to be a comedy/horror. Where the he** was the comedy?? Do yourself a favor, don't watch. You'll have a gd nights sleep if you don't.
Watching someone be mentally and physically tortured

Why would anyone invest their time and money into making this movie??? It was revolting. Gross and absurd. An insult to anyone's intelligence and a complete waste of precious time. It started out not too badly, so I decided to watch it. Some funny lines. Some character development. The main character was sort of interesting. Also, as a Canadian I thought it might be funny to watch.I won't add any spoilers. But, at a certain point I just fast forwarded through it - hoping the movie might get a little better - it didn't.A reminder to look at some reviews before wasting time watching a movie.

Go into it open minded, the acting is phenomenal and parks is scary believable. I thought his Red state performance scarred me but this straight ruined me loll.I had seen all the online videos about the podcast and how everything came together as far as funding, cast, etc.My friends did not and said they still enjoyed it but they are very open minded and familiar with Kevin smiths previous works and outlook.I would say if you're open minded and enjoy different... don't watch the podcast video. If you are hesitant or have any doubts watch the podcast and it truly is amazing how this movie came to be and listening to artists create real time (even if they are stoned loll). Its very inspirational.Mild spoiler ... although its revealed in the first 30 minutes: If I could ask Kevin Smith any question about the movie it would be why he decided to make Justin Longs character unfaithful. Knowing what would eventually happen to him I found myself saying oh hes an a hole anyways so it made it hard to sympathize with him originally but then u see how bad it gets aha. either way I'm just curious the reason behind it I wasn't expecting it and thought it was interesting.Great movie.

Review title: A Low Star Movie Lovers Dream
Review_body: My fiancé and I started watching this one without doing our research first and just went off of our true love for Justin Long.
